I completely agree with you. Martin Scorsese is a master filmmaker who has a unique ability to create compelling characters and complex relationships, as demonstrated in "The Departed." Scorsese's direction highlights the subtleties of each relationship, capturing the nuances of their dynamics and motivations. The interweaving of the relationships throughout the film creates a web of intrigue that keeps the audience engaged and invested in the story.

The performances of the actors also add to the complexity of the relationships in the film. Each actor brings their character's motivations and traits to life and imbues their scenes with a sense of tension and authenticity. It's a testament to Scorsese's skill as a director that he is able to get such riveting performances from his actors.

In conclusion, the complexity of relationships in the criminal underworld in "The Departed" is a testament to Martin Scorsese's directing and the sharp performances of the actors. The film's suspenseful and intricate plot results in a compelling and thoroughly enjoyable cinematic experience.
